primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of condemnation by substituting His Son for the guilty, thereby transforming the status of the 'perpetrator' into the 'righteousness of God'.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has revealed to us through the Spirit
God has intervened on our side
God made him to be sin
that in him we might become the righteousness of God
the power of God for a transformed life
what God has prepared for those who love him
to us who are being saved
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strictly with the Receiver/Beneficiary.

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (The Crucified) / The Holy Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Initiator) and Helper (Mediator in Christ).
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the agent of 'Savoir-faire' (revelation) and 'Pouvoir-faire' (power).

tegenstander.identificatie: Common Sense / Worldly Wisdom / Sin & Death
tekstueel_bewijs: condemned to death because of sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but a total epistemic and ontological barrier (Sin/Death/Folly).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The sermon focuses almost exclusively on the Primary Program (Soteriology). Ethics are mentioned only as a 'transformed life' resulting from the Cross.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Saved Sinner
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'transformed life' is a fruit of the 'Power of God', not a condition for it.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God made him to be sin

voorbeelden: What we acknowledge on Ash Wednesday
We might like to think of our faith as spiritual uplift
That we might understand the gifts
The cross is the power of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Power' sermon. It assumes the hearer lacks the ability (Pouvoir) and the knowledge (Savoir) to save themselves, which God provides as a gift.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S2 (Easy steps/Common sense) to S2 (The reality of the death penalty/Sin) to S1 (The Cross as the Power of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 (Judgment) to move the Receiver to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon emphasizes that the situation is 'serious' and involves a 'death penalty'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; the human is the passive recipient of a 'scandalous' intervention.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The One who hangs there is the Son of God, who suffered the death penalty instead of us.
I did not come to tell you something that you could have figured out for yourselves.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul) are presented as messengers of a power, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul is a 'weak' vessel for God's 'strong' power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe at the 'scandal' of being included despite being a 'perpetrator'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is tightly focused on the movement from human 'folly' to divine 'power'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Common Sense' and 'The Cross'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God made him to be sin... so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Savoir' (understanding) and 'Pouvoir' (salvation) that the world lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as a capital crime requiring a death penalty.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon perfectly maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic kerygmatic sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death Penalty) is already sufficiently grave.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, avoiding all traps of moralism by keeping the Cross as the active engine of the narrative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'common sense' anecdotes, Greimas reveals that these anecdotes serve to define the 'Opponent' (Worldly Wisdom).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: The analysis focuses on the functional roles of God and Man rather than just the historical context of Corinth.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas identifies that the 'scandal' is actually a functional Subject-switch where God takes the role of the Opponent's target (the condemned) to benefit the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the Darrell Mease story not as a moral example for us to follow, but as an actantial mirror of God's non-sensical grace.
